'''''Limacella illinita''''', or '''Overflowing Slimy Stem''', is a mushroom in the genus ''[[Limacella]]'', in the family ''[[Amanitaceae]]''.

==Description==

* '''Cap''' : It has approximately 2–7 cm long [[radius]]. It is round becoming convex then wide or with a broad umbo, the margin hanging with slimy veil remnants. It is white or cream in color. It feels smooth and sticky or slimy.<ref name=Rogers>{{cite web|title=Limacella illinita |url=http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~6342.asp |publisher=Rogers Mushrooms |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111107082243/http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~6342.asp |archivedate=2011-11-07 }}</ref><ref name="Book ref">{{cite book|last=Bessette|first=Alan|title=Mushrooms of northeastern North America|year=1997|publisher=[[Syracuse University Press]]|location=[[New York City|New York]], United States|isbn=0-8156-2707-6|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=T2uU12XcRD4C&pg=PA194&dq=Limacella+illinita&hl=en&ei=lHd8Tu6dJ4jXrQfz1snjDw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=10&ved=0CF0Q6AEwCQ#v=onepage&q=Limacella%20illinita&f=false|author2=Arleen Rainis Bessette |author3=David William Fischer |page=194|chapter=Gilled Mushrooms}}</ref>
* '''Gills''' : They are free, non-waxy, close, broad and white in color.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>
* '''Stem / Stipe''' : The 5–10 cm long stem tapers a bit towards the top. It is fleshy, soft and has a ring. White in color, it is also sticky and slimy.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>
* '''Spores''' : Spores are globose to broadly ellipsoid and smooth.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>
* '''Microscopic features''' : The spores measure 4.5-6.5 x 4-6 um.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>
* '''Flesh''' : Flesh is slimy and sticky.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>
* '''Fruiting''' : These mushrooms flower in between August or July and October or November.<ref name="Rogers"/><ref name="Book ref"/>

==Distribution and habitat==

''L. illinita'' is widely distributed in [[North America]] and often found in [[Europe]]. These can habitat singly, scattered, or in groups in [[wood]]s, [[swamp]]s, [[Field (agriculture)|field]]s, [[lawn]]s, [[road]]sides and [[sand dune]]s.

==Bioactive compounds==
[[File:Muurolane.svg|thumb|120px|left|The skeletal formula of muurolane.]]
A study in 2007 discovered four new [[Bioactive compound|bioactive]] [[Chemical compound|compound]]s from [[basidiomycetes]], isolated from [[Fermentation (biochemistry)|fermentations]] of ''L. illinita'': Illinitone A that exhibited weak [[phytotoxic]] and moderate nematicidal activities against ''Caenorhabditis elegans'', Illinitone B that was moderately [[cytotoxic]], Limacellone that exhibited weak [[cytotoxic]] and [[phytotoxic]] activities and muurolane sesquiterpene 4a that was found to be inactive in the assays performed there.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Gruhn|first=Nina|author2=Sylvia Schoettler |author3=Olov Sterner |author4=Timm Anke |title=Biologically active metabolites from the basidiomycete Limacella illinita (Fr.) Murr.|journal=Zeitschrift für Naturforschung C|volume=62|issue=11-12|pmid=18274282|pages=808–812|publisher=Department of Biotechnology, University of Kaiserslautern.|location=Germany|issn=0939-5075}}</ref>
